said David Letterman . "Being pummeled?" Anderson Cooper said. "I don't recommend it. I'd never been hit in the head before." He described the scene, saying, People came from all around, surrounding us, punching us, kicking us, trying to rip the clothes off my female producer. It was weird. And we were lucky, frankly.... I would start to slap back and then realize this is going to make it worse. My adrenline was pumping so much. I've never really been in a fight like this or attacked by a mob like this. I thought I was saying calm down, as if they could understand what I was saying. Bernie Sanders said in his letter that the nation's political climate had been damaged by a "right-wing media echo chamber" that is transmitting a reactionary world view to the tens of millions of millions of Americans who watch or listen to them every day. In a separate statement, state Republican Chairman Steve Larrabee said: "By using this tragedy to demonize those he disagrees with, the Barack Obama is doing exactly what he pretends to deplore."
